intro: Silene maurorum, commonly known as the Mauretanian campion, is a flowering plant native to North Africa and the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Silene maurorum is often found in open habitats such as coastal dunes and scrublands.
